subs.text: This train wreck was over 10 years in the making, and the party that would have, could have, should have prevented it‚Ä¶ didn‚Äôt.
subs.rawText: This train wreck was over 10 years in the making, and the party that would have, could have, should have prevented it‚Ä¶ didn‚Äôt.

subs.text: I decided a few years to let that party wander aimlessly without me (but they still have my vote) and joined a German party. I may not be able to vote here yet, but I helped pick party leaders and a Chancellor candidate who‚Äôs now in power.
subs.rawText: I decided a few years to let that party wander aimlessly without me (but they still have my vote) and joined a German party. I may not be able to vote here yet, but I helped pick party leaders and a Chancellor candidate who‚Äôs now in power.

subs.text: And is checking off the boxes on their campaign promises, like just today on freedom of information for abortion providers [link]
subs.rawText: And is checking off the boxes on their campaign promises, like just today on freedom of information for abortion providers https://t.co/lDiTROwiTX

subs.text: Political involvement is also part business strategy. My wife belongs to the other main German party, but the left wing of the one party overlaps a lot with the right wing of the other. We then have a foot in the door of a lot of politicians where we can voice our concerns.
subs.rawText: Political involvement is also part business strategy. My wife belongs to the other main German party, but the left wing of the one party overlaps a lot with the right wing of the other. We then have a foot in the door of a lot of politicians where we can voice our concerns.

subs.text: Or to do good. Through personal, media and political contacts, we were able to prevent an Afghan couple who work for us from deportation. They‚Äôve now become permanent residents. /Fin [link]
subs.rawText: Or to do good. Through personal, media and political contacts, we were able to prevent an Afghan couple who work for us from deportation. They‚Äôve now become permanent residents. /Fin https://t.co/nR59In9Amk

subs.text: Europes largest rail switchyard is in Maschen near Hamburg, serving the harbor. That bridge for cars going across (built in 1973) has been closed since 2016, rebuilding will be complicated as it may contain asbestos. Construction might start in 2024. [link] https://t.co/XSPm10TcUf
